Project Title: SafexpressOps: An Agentic AI Platform for Intelligent Workflow Automation and Company-Aware Operational Analytics

Capstone Class Coordinator: Lintag, Leonid C.
Oral defense date: July 17, 2025

metadata.context: Introduction to the scope and limitations of the project.

chunks.text:
Capstone Project Scope and Limitations:
Scope and Limitations
Scope

metadata.context: Overview of the project's focus and components.

chunks.text: This capstone project focuses on the development of SafexpressOps, a web based logistics support platform powered by Agentic Artificial Intelligence, specifically tailored to enhance the operational workflows of Safexpress Logistics Inc. The core components and features included within the project scope are:

metadata.context: Details about the AI-powered knowledge base feature.

chunks.text:
AI Powered Knowledge Base
- Consolidates manuals, company policies, warehouse-specific workflows, client requirements, and internal structures into a centralized database, accessible via a conversational AI assistant.

metadata.context: Technical details of the AI knowledge base.

chunks.text: Weaviate vector database is used in the construction of the centralized knowledge base. OpenAI's text-embedding-ada-002 model is used to index all documents by translating their text into numerical representations. When a user searches, the most contextually relevant content is found by ranking relevance using cosine similarity. The system employs version control for any modified documents, detects and flags duplicate source files upon upload, and has automated data cleanup functions to preserve data integrity.

Limitations
This project aims to provide significant automation and intelligent support; however, there are some limitations to be acknowledged:

metadata.context: Limitation regarding the personal assistant feature.

chunks.text: a. Agent Personal Assistant features will not be available to all users during the initial version. Token consumption will be monitored, and access will be allocated only to users who critically require the functionality.

b. Testing data access will be limited to up to six (6) months, depending on data volume, or all will be dummy data. This is to avoid exceeding usage limits under the free-tier plan, prevent undue financial burden on the student developers currently working on the system, and protect their sensitive data.
